metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with SH after you free her from the pod aboard the nautiloid. You can bring her with you in a bid to escape together, or leave her to fend for herself. Different branches if the player is gith, looks like a gith or has a gith follower/companion. In each case, Shadowheart retrieves the Orpheus box towards the end of the diialogue from her pod, then joins the player or leaves by herself.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Recon goto 9 -352give S_TUT_TransformChamber_PodKeyUse Console near Shadowheart's Pod

3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart is on her knees, having just been ejected from her pod. She gets to her feet

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: I thought that damn thing was going to be my coffin. Thank you -
88.context: NodeContext: Relieved at being free - cut off at the end (by a mindmeld)

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Your mind lurches into her thoughts. Her gratitude is mixed with wariness - because you look like a gith.*
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH and the player react to a psionic mind meldInternalNodeContext: SH and the player react to a psionic mind meld

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: You're a gith... why did you help me?

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: And you expect what in return exactly? Githyanki aren't given to charity.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: That's what your kind does - they take. Still... you did help me.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: You may prove useful to me in getting off this ship - as a decoy in battle, perhaps.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: Sounds in line with what I've heard about your kind.

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.text: I'm grateful, but don't expect me to be your pawn just because you freed me.

6.speaker: Shadowheart
6.text: We both need all the help we can get. Let's try to get off this thing together.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: What could the likes of you possibly know of my people?

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: I know enough. But I'll risk it over certain death.
1.context: NodeContext: Spoken with some aggression.She's convinced gith are bad news.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: We are finished. Be on your way, elf. Survive if you can.

65.speaker: Shadowheart
65.text: Half-elf. Better I go alone, actually. A group your size would slow me down...

5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reaches into her pod and fetches an ornate box. She quickly puts it away, and leaves

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: Half-elf. And maybe we should travel together for now... in the interest of survival.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: First you beg for help, then cast suspicion on me, and now you want to join me? You are an odd one.

92.speaker: Shadowheart
92.text: I suppose I am. Fitting company for a decidedly odd situation, wouldn't you say?
92.context: NodeContext: Little bit of wry self-awareness. 'Yes I know I can seem difficult'.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: We both need to get off this thing. Let's help each other.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Very well, come with me. But if you prove a burden, I will leave you behind.

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: Wait - looks like you've a full complement already. We'd make for easy targets, all grouped together like that.

72.speaker: Shadowheart
72.text: I think I'll take my chances alone if it's all the same - less conspicuous. Good luck - and thank you.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Wait - you're not actually the one in charge of this group, are you? No offence, but I need to speak to a leader. Someone who knows where they're going.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I'll have to do, for now.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: I'm afraid not. Good luck to you - I'll take my chances alone.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I've changed my mind. Find your own way off this ship.

86.speaker: Shadowheart
86.text: Gladly. And best of luck. You'll need it.

54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reaches into her pod and fetches an ornate box. She quickly puts it away.|

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: Enough of this chatter. We need to get to the helm - now.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart throws a suspicous look at Lae'zel NodeContext: Impatient

83.speaker: Shadowheart
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks at  the player again (had glanced suspiciously at Lae'zel on previous node)

44.speaker: Shadowheart
44.text: There's no time to spare. Lead the way.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart is looking at the player (ie no Lae'zel inclusion occurred).NodeContext: Resolute.

89.speaker: Lae'zel
89.text: Finally. Let us make for the helm - we've wasted enough time already.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart throws a suspicous look at Lae'zel NodeContext: Impatient

55.speaker: Player
55.text: As I said, we are finished. Go.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: Consider me gone. Maybe I'll see you around - if you survive, that is.

37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reaches into her pod and fetches an ornate box. She quickly puts it away, and leaves

9.speaker: Player
9.text: A curious tone, for one who owes her life to me.

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: Not so curious. I've heard what gith are like. Still... you did free me.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Did you feel that just now? We were in each other's heads.

18.speaker: Shadowheart
18.text: I did... It must be because of those parasites they put in us...

38.speaker: Shadowheart
38.text: We need to deal with that, but first we've to get off this thing... let's join up.

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *Your mind lurches into her thoughts. Her gratitude is mixed with wariness - because you have a gith with you.*
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH and the player react to a psionic mind meldInternalNodeContext: SH and the player react to a psionic mind meld

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Dangerous company's what you need in a fight.

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: Fair point. Looks like there's plenty of fighting ahead.

99.speaker: Shadowheart
99.text: More that gith have a problem with everyone else. But there's more important matters right now - survival.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Did you feel that just now? We were in each other's heads.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: They'll have to wait. I need to get off this ship alive first.

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: Let me come with you. We can get off this ship, and watch each other's backs along the way.
43.context: NodeContext: A little caution on 'watch each other's backs' - implying lingering distrust of the gith who's with them

0.speaker: Player
0.text: All right then, let's get going. I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Did you feel what I felt just before? We were in each other's heads.

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: But that'll have to wait. Are we going to help each other, or not?

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I've changed my mind - you're on your own.

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: Are you sure about that? Better odds of surviving if we help each other.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: All right then, come on. I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Like I said, you're on your own.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: I'm used to it. Good luck... and thank you, for your help.
21.context: InternalNodeContext: SH runs off, not to be seen again until den recruitment.

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *Your mind lurches into her thoughts. You feel her gratitude, but also guardedness. And above all, a will to survive.*

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'm getting out of here. Follow me, if you can keep up.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Did you feel that just now? We were in each other's heads.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: You'd better get out of here - it's everyone for themselves.
